definition: to faint from fear/to be frightened into fits/shell-shocked
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)

sentences.english: I nearly freaked out when he promised to marry me.
sentences.chinese: 當他答應娶我時，我幾乎嚇昏了。

sentences.english: I had a blue fit when she walked into the room;
sentences.chinese: 她走進房間時，我嚇昏了，我還以爲她已經去世多年。

sentences.english: I had a blue fit when he walked into the room, I thought he had died years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他走進房間來時，我嚇昏了，我以爲他多年前就死了。
那意外事件把他們嚇昏了。

sentences.english: He was already frightened at the suspicion that had fallen upon him, without quite knowing why.
sentences.chinese: 他已經被這個莫名其妙地把他牽連在內的嫌疑嚇昏了。

sentences.english: I need to be been returning to in front, but being come out by a snake Cuan to stun.
sentences.chinese: 我待要回前頭，卻被一條蛇躥出來嚇昏了。

sentences.english: I had a blue fit when she walked into the room; I thought she had died years ago.
sentences.chinese: 她走進房間時，我嚇昏了，我還以爲她已經去世多年。

sentences.english: It was Passepartout who, playing his part with a happy audacity, had passed through the crowd amid the general terror.
sentences.chinese: 正是他，若無其事地走過那一片被嚇昏了的人羣。

sentences.english: They were terrorized and discoloured by the thought of an approaching death.
sentences.chinese: 他們早已被死到臨頭的想法嚇昏了。
